description: Prime numbers with every digit a perfect square, i.e. consisting of only digits 0, 1, 4, 9.
links: R. Ondrejka, The Top Ten: a Catalogue of Primal Configurations.
example: a(10) = 419, 419 is a prime and 1, 4 and 9 are squares.
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 23 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), May 17 2005
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 29 2008 at the suggestion of R. J. Mathar
